New Records: Sese Bau became the second Papua New Guinea batter to hit a fifty in the T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Romario Shepherd claimed the wicket of Tony Ura in the second over
Akeal Hosein dismissed Lega Siaka with a well-executed arm ball
Alzarri Joseph sent Assad Vala back to the pavilion
Sese Bau fell, PNG struggled to accelerate
Fabian Allen and Roston Chase maintained tight lines and restricted the run flow during the middle overs
Pre-Game Insights: WI captain Rovman Powell won the toss and chose to bowl vs Papua New Guinea
Post-Match Reflections: Sese Bau etched his name into Papua New Guinea cricket history by becoming the second batter from his country to score a fifty in the T20 World Cup match against the West Indies
Miscellaneous Highlights: PNG, making their second T20 World Cup appearance, faced an uphill battle from the outset
Sese Bau's 50 off 43 balls was a masterclass in resilience and tactical shot-making, helping stabilize the innings
Bau adeptly rotated the strike and found occasional boundaries, ensuring the scoreboard kept ticking
Others: The left-handed batter's impressive knock follows in the footsteps of team captain Assad Vala, who achieved a similar milestone against Oman in the 2021 edition of the tournament
